document_title: Foreskin inflammation: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content:
1. Use medicine
With mild inflammation, special oral medications (antibiotics, anti-inflammatories, anti-virus, pain-reducing, etc.) will help eliminate pathogens and quickly relieve unpleasant symptoms.
When treating diseases with antibiotics, doctors may prescribe certain groups of drugs such as:
Antibiotics polymyxin, neomycin, penicillin, chloramphenicol, glycerine, sorbolene...: Treatment of inflammatory problems caused by bacteria.; Antiviral drugs such as valacyclovir or famciclovir: May be prescribed if the balanitis is caused by a virus.
When using antibiotics, patients should pay attention to some important things to minimize the risk of the body developing antibiotic resistance:
Make sure to take antibiotics at the exact dose prescribed by your doctor, no more and no less; Absolutely do not share your antibiotics with those around you. Because your medicine may not be suitable for someone else, even if they have the same disease.
2. Surgery
For people with chronic inflammation who have been treated with medication but have not been effective, the doctor may recommend surgery to remove the foreskin. Currently, circumcision techniques are quite diverse, often prescribed based on each patient's age, health conditions and level of inflammation.
